***Obsolete**: This article refers to an aspect of the game which has been removed. It is retained for historical reference only.*

- *This page is about the player [species](/Species "Species"). For the monster, see [Halfling (monster)](/Halfling_\(monster\) "Halfling (monster)").*

|   |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| - | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | Halflings, who are named for being about half the size of Humans, live in small villages. They live simple lives and have simple interests. Sometimes a particularly restless Halfling will leave his or her village in search of adventure.Halflings are very small but surprisingly hardy for their size, even having an innate resistance to mutagenic effects. They can use short blades and shields very well, are passable with long blades, and excel in ranged combat with slings. They are also very stealthy and dextrous, but are poor at magic (except for charms, translocations, and air magic). They advance in levels as rapidly as Humans. Halflings cannot wield large weapons. |

## Contents

- [1 Innate Abilities](#Innate_Abilities)
- [2 Preferred Backgrounds](#Preferred_Backgrounds)
- [3 Level Bonuses](#Level_Bonuses)
- [4 Starting Skills and Equipment](#Starting_Skills_and_Equipment)
- [5 Difficulty of Play](#Difficulty_of_Play)
- [6 Skill aptitudes](#Skill_aptitudes)
- [7 History](#History)

## Innate Abilities

- **[Mutation Resistance](/Mutation_Resistance "Mutation Resistance") 1:** Halflings resist 66.6% of all mutation effects (even beneficial mutation effects). This innate mutation resistance stacks with other sources of [mutation resistance](/Mutation_resistance "Mutation resistance").
- Halflings are [small](/Size#Player_Sizes "Size") creatures. The following weapons are too large for them: [bardiches](/Bardiche "Bardiche"), [battleaxes](/Battleaxe "Battleaxe"), [dire flails](/Dire_flail "Dire flail"), [executioner's axes](/Executioner%27s_axe "Executioner's axe"), [glaives](/Glaive "Glaive"), [great maces](/Great_mace "Great mace"), [great swords](/Great_sword "Great sword"), [halberds](/Halberd "Halberd"), [longbows](/Longbow "Longbow"), [scythes](/Scythe "Scythe"), [triple swords](/Triple_sword "Triple sword"), [giant clubs](/Giant_club "Giant club"), [giant spiked clubs](/Giant_spiked_club "Giant spiked club"), and [javelins](/Javelin "Javelin"). One-handed weapons like [magical staves](/Magical_staves "Magical staves"), [broad axes](/Broad_axe "Broad axe"), [tridents](/Trident "Trident"), [demon tridents](/Demon_trident "Demon trident") and [double swords](/Double_sword "Double sword") are two-handed weapons to them. They have more trouble with [bucklers](/Buckler "Buckler") and [kite shields](/Kite_shield "Kite shield"), and can't use [tower shields](/Tower_shield "Tower shield").
- Halflings, due to their small size, get bonuses to [evasion](/Evasion "Evasion") and [stealth](/Stealth "Stealth") (beyond just having good aptitudes in the relevant skills).

Halflings have a base [Strength](/Strength "Strength") of 8, [Intelligence](/Intelligence "Intelligence") of 7 and [Dexterity](/Dexterity "Dexterity") of 9 (before Background modifiers) and have normal base [magic points](/Magic_points "Magic points").

## Preferred Backgrounds

- **Warriors:** [Fighter](/Fighter "Fighter"), [Hunter](/Hunter "Hunter")
- **Zealots:** [Berserker](/Berserker "Berserker"), [Abyssal Knight](/Abyssal_Knight "Abyssal Knight")

## Level Bonuses

- +1 [dexterity](/Dexterity "Dexterity") every 5th level.
- 10% less [hit points](/Hit_points "Hit points") than average.
- +3 [willpower](/Willpower "Willpower") per level.

## Starting Skills and Equipment

Halflings start with all the equipment and skills listed for their background, with the following exception:

- [Javelins](/Javelin "Javelin") are replaced with [boomerangs](/Boomerang "Boomerang").

## Difficulty of Play

|                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
| -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **[Simple](/Category:Easy_species "Category:Easy species")** • [Intermediate](/Category:Moderate_species "Category:Moderate species") • [Advanced](/Category:Hard_species "Category:Hard species") |

Halflings are a fairly easy species to play due to the fact that they have many benefits from their small size, with few drawbacks. As far as the small species go they are robust (only -10% HP) but still receive bonuses to EV and stealth, while also having fine aptitudes in [dodging](/Dodging "Dodging"), [stealth](/Stealth "Stealth"), and [armour](/Armour "Armour") skills, among others. Halflings' innate mutation resistance occasionally comes in handy, as well, though it is far from the main draw of the species.

## History

- Halfings were removed in [0.27](/0.27 "0.27"), removing the last major Tolkienian species.
- Prior to its removal in [0.26](/0.26 "0.26"), Halflings had a +1 aptitude for the [Charms](/Charms "Charms") school.
- Halfling aptitudes were rebalanced yet again in [0.19](/0.19 "0.19"). Prior to this change, they had: [Short Blades](/Short_Blades "Short Blades") +3, [Maces & Flails](/Maces_%26_Flails "Maces & Flails") -2, [Axes](/Axes "Axes") -1, [Polearms](/Polearms "Polearms") -3, [Throwing](/Throwing "Throwing") +3, [Bows](/Bows "Bows") +2, [Crossbows](/Crossbows "Crossbows") -1, [Hexes](/Hexes "Hexes") -1, [Summoning](/Summoning "Summoning") -1, [Air Magic](/Air_Magic "Air Magic") +1, [Poison Magic](/Poison_Magic "Poison Magic") -1, and [Evocations](/Evocations "Evocations") +1. All other aptitudes were unchanged.
- Halfling stealth aptitude changed from 1 to 2 in [0.16](/0.16 "0.16").
- Halfling stats and aptitudes were rebalanced in [0.15](/0.15 "0.15"). They also had [Slow Metabolism](/Slow_Metabolism "Slow Metabolism") prior to that version.
- Prior to [0.14](/0.14 "0.14"), halflings could not use throwing nets.
- Halflings were much improved in [0.6](/0.6 "0.6"). This update improved their Shields proficiency and HP/level, and also made slings more useful through the addition of branded bullets.

This page is about the player species. For the monster, see Halfling (monster).
Halflings, who are named for being about half the size of Humans, live in small villages. They live simple lives and have simple interests. Sometimes a particularly restless Halfling will leave his or her village in search of adventure.

Halflings are very small but surprisingly hardy for their size, even having an innate resistance to mutagenic effects. They can use short blades and shields very well, are passable with long blades, and excel in ranged combat with slings. They are also very stealthy and dextrous, but are poor at magic (except for charms, translocations, and air magic). They advance in levels as rapidly as Humans. Halflings cannot wield large weapons.

Contents

  • 1 Innate Abilities
  • 2 Preferred Backgrounds
  • 3 Level Bonuses
  • 4 Starting Skills and Equipment
  • 5 Difficulty of Play
  • 6 Skill aptitudes
  • 7 History

Innate Abilities

  • Mutation Resistance 1: Halflings resist 66.6% of all mutation effects (even beneficial mutation effects). This innate mutation resistance stacks with other sources of mutation resistance.
  • Halflings are small creatures. The following weapons are too large for them: bardiches, battleaxes, dire flails, executioner's axes, glaives, great maces, great swords, halberds, longbows, scythes, triple swords, giant clubs, giant spiked clubs, and javelins. One-handed weapons like magical staves, broad axes, tridents, demon tridents and double swords are two-handed weapons to them. They have more trouble with bucklers and kite shields, and can't use tower shields.
  • Halflings, due to their small size, get bonuses to evasion and stealth (beyond just having good aptitudes in the relevant skills).

Halflings have a base Strength of 8, Intelligence of 7 and Dexterity of 9 (before Background modifiers) and have normal base magic points.

Preferred Backgrounds

  • Warriors: Fighter, Hunter
  • Zealots: Berserker, Abyssal Knight

Level Bonuses

  • +1 dexterity every 5th level.
  • 10% less hit points than average.
  • +3 willpower per level.

Starting Skills and Equipment

Halflings start with all the equipment and skills listed for their background, with the following exception:

  • Javelins are replaced with boomerangs.

Difficulty of Play

Simple • Intermediate • Advanced

Halflings are a fairly easy species to play due to the fact that they have many benefits from their small size, with few drawbacks. As far as the small species go they are robust (only -10% HP) but still receive bonuses to EV and stealth, while also having fine aptitudes in dodging, stealth, and armour skills, among others. Halflings' innate mutation resistance occasionally comes in handy, as well, though it is far from the main draw of the species.

Skill aptitudes

Values are from the most recent version that had both the species and the skill:

History

  • Halfings were removed in 0.27, removing the last major Tolkienian species.
  • Prior to its removal in 0.26, Halflings had a +1 aptitude for the Charms school.
  • Halfling aptitudes were rebalanced yet again in 0.19. Prior to this change, they had: Short Blades +3, Maces & Flails -2, Axes -1, Polearms -3, Throwing +3, Bows +2, Crossbows -1, Hexes -1, Summoning -1, Air Magic +1, Poison Magic -1, and Evocations +1. All other aptitudes were unchanged.
  • Halfling stealth aptitude changed from 1 to 2 in 0.16.
  • Halfling stats and aptitudes were rebalanced in 0.15. They also had Slow Metabolism prior to that version.
  • Prior to 0.14, halflings could not use throwing nets.
  • Halflings were much improved in 0.6. This update improved their Shields proficiency and HP/level, and also made slings more useful through the addition of branded bullets.
